game.title: The official name of the game.
game.gameDescription: A concise overview of the puzzle gameplay concept and overall player experience.
game.releaseYear: The year the game was first released to the public.
game.developer: The studio or individual responsible for developing the game.
game.publisher: The company responsible for publishing and distributing the game.
game.platform: Primary platforms the game is designed to run on (e.g., mobile).
game.perspective: The visual viewpoint used to present the game board to the player.

vision.description: High-level design intent describing the experience the game aims to deliver.
vision.designGoals: Core principles guiding all design decisions.
vision.playerFantasy: The role or mindset the player adopts while playing.
vision.successMetrics: Measures used to evaluate whether design goals are met.

targetAudience.description: Intended player demographic and usage context.
targetAudience.playerTypes: Categories of players the game targets.
targetAudience.skillLevel: Expected learning curve and mastery depth.

platformConstraints.description: Technical and usability limitations imposed by mobile platforms.
platformConstraints.sessionLengthMinutes: Expected minimum and maximum play session duration.
platformConstraints.performanceTargetFPS: Desired frame rate for smooth gameplay.

coreBoard.description: The primary puzzle playfield where all gameplay interactions occur.
coreBoard.gridType: The structural layout of the board.
coreBoard.gridDimensions: The size and shape of the playable grid.
coreBoard.cellRules: Rules governing how grid cells can be occupied or cleared.

blocks.description: Fundamental puzzle pieces placed by the player.
blocks.blockOrientationRules: Rules governing rotation or fixed orientation.
blocks.blockAvailability: How blocks are presented to the player.

placementRules.description: Rules that define how blocks can be placed on the board.
placementRules.validPlacementConditions: Conditions required for a successful placement.
placementRules.invalidPlacementFeedback: How the game communicates invalid actions.

lineClearSystem.description: Rules governing the clearing of completed lines or areas.
lineClearSystem.clearConditions: What constitutes a completed line or pattern.
lineClearSystem.clearEffects: What happens when a clear condition is met.

scoringSystem.description: Rules for calculating and awarding points.
scoringSystem.comboScoring: Bonus scoring for chained or consecutive clears.

progression.description: How player progress is tracked over time.
progression.runBasedProgress: Progress within a single play session.

difficultyDesign.playerFailPressure: How the game pushes the player toward failure.

failureState.description: Conditions that end a play session.
failureState.failureCondition: What causes the game to end.
failureState.failureFeedback: How failure is communicated to the player.

ui.description: User interface elements and visual communication systems.

hud.hudElements: Types of information displayed during gameplay.

feedback.description: Visual and audio responses to player actions.

artDirection.visualStyle: Overall look and feel of the game.
artDirection.colorUsage: Rules for color application and contrast.

musicDesign.adaptive: Whether music reacts to gameplay state.

audioDesign.soundDesignRules: Guidelines for sound effect clarity and feedback.

monetization.inAppPurchases: Types of purchasable items or benefits.

accessibility.inputSimplicity: Ease of interaction and control clarity.

gameFlow.description: High-level structure of the game experience.
gameFlow.gameFlowStates: Distinct phases from launch to game over.

technicalNotes.engineAgnostic: Whether the design is tied to a specific engine.

references.inspirations: Games or works influencing the design.
